comment: This app has completed my life.

title: Amazon music not in the list
comment: I use amazon music and it's not in the list of apps. I can't pick it as an option so this app is useless to me

title: Unreliable with LG G4
comment: Under the G4's Android 5.1, the default media player starts over half the time, instead of Media Button Router intercepting the Bluetooth play request.

title: Works well, mostly.
comment: I got a new lg g4 and my car's Bluetooth audio would autoplay the default media player, even taking over for the currently playing media player. It made it almost unusable. This app seems too have mostly fixed the problem. However, for some reason Amazon mp3 doesn't show up in the list of apps. This app still seems to prevent the default media player from taking over, so I'll take it.

title: No longer working on Lollipop Nexus 6
comment: This used to work great for fixing the Android problem of not playing music when I get in my car and my radio gives a BT play AVRCP command. However, at this point it's as though this app isn't installed at all and my stock Nexus 6 almost never plays music when requested without taking my phone or of my pocket and unlocking, launching Poweramp and hitting Play on the screen.

When you hit the "Play" button on your Bluetooth device, Android is very unpredictable in which App it's going to choose, if it does anything at all.  This App fills a puzzling design oversight in Android Bluetooth media control, allowing the device to be a lot smarter when handling multiple media Apps.   Now I know that when I put on my headphones or go back to my car, playback will pick up exactly where I left off, with the option of changing it through the pop-up menu. Also, when the signal gets interrupted due to interference, recovery is more predictable.

title: Md saddam hussain
comment: This app is white elephant for me
Works great on Moto X

title: Finally!
comment: The one app that stopped the stupid music player app from starting by default in my car every time I turned on bluetooth!

title: Amazing
comment: The app i was looking for. The perfect companion to Soundcloud and my S10 :)

title: Good
comment: Very nice

title: Perfect
comment: This app used to work perfectly but has stopped working for some reason. It no longer appears when my car stereo connects to my phone. Disappointing.

title: Great App But Have One Suggestion
comment: This is a great app. It annoys me that whenever my phone pairs with my car, it automatically starts playing my music. Sometimes the songs that play are ones that I downloaded for my daughter and even she is embarrassed about them as well. This app lets you determine which apps should playback instead.  My suggestion is as follows, and I know this can be accomplished with Tasker but I feel this is way easier to use for Joe Schmo. Please allow the user to designate which app should launch. For example, I use Serius XM to listen to Howard Stern during my drive. It would be awesome if I could get Sirius XM app to launch via Media Button Router. Unfortunately, the Sirius XM app is not recognized as a media playback app so I cannot designate it in the Media Button Router UI. If you allow the user to designate which app they wish to launch, that would be a great advantage for people using apps that are also not recognized as media playback apps.  Again, great app. It is a must for anyone wanting full control on their phone.

title: Problem solver
comment: This app fixes the common but widespread problem of default media apps. It is essential for people who frequently use media players or PTT communications apps like Zello

title: Cool
comment: Allows me to map the Bluetooth pause/play button to launch a voice assistant instead of music. I had to have two items in the selection list and set the default to launch my app, with just one item in the list commands are routed to the app instead of launching it.

title: Life saver
comment: I swear to god if I have to listen to "over the horizon" one more time I may have had to microwave my cell phone. Thank you for creating this app that just works. Now we just need slightly better Spotify support.

title: Awesome!
comment: My Audiobook player wouldn't listen to my Bluetooth controller anymore... This app worked perfectly! Just picked the single app, disabled the confirmation and the button presses just work! Amazing!

title: Excellent App - got it working in my motorcycle helmet!
comment: After a lot of research and phone calls to Google, I finally found the right utility app to get the job done.  A+++  I use a Sena SMH10 Bluetooth headset in my motorcycle helmet, and no matter what I did, I could not get past the default Samsung S5 music player - until now.  Install this program.  Select Google Play Now in the list, as well as S-Voice.  You need to say "open app play music" to run Google Play, as opposed to simply saying "Play Music" as a command.  Set Google as the default, and all works as expected.  The other headset buttons allow me to pause, next, previous just like the standard music player does.  Great little app, and I'd be happy to pay for this if it was not free.  5-stars, and many thanks to the developer!
That

title: Delivers
comment: Does exactly what it should.

title: Working perfectly
comment: Settings on media button router enabled the skip and play for Pandora for my Ultimate Car Dock app on Galaxy s5.

title: Fixes Android
comment: Android has a serious problem with determining which music related apps should be controlled by Bluetooth media controls. Just installing this and disabling the speech stuff and reducing the timeout makes it direct the buttons to the media app currently open or active correctly after you press your first media button. Amazing!

title: Fixed Bluetooth Issues
comment: This app allowed my Bluetooth headset's buttons to continue working after my phone went to sleep.

title: Unintended use case?
comment: It works absolutely great for me.  I don't want my phone to begin playing anything just because I've turned on my car,  so I let this intercept it and prompt me each time.  I just ignore it.  Perfect success at suppressing Autoplay.

title: Irritating problem solved
comment: Does exactly what I wanted - stop media players from starting when pressing bluetooth button. I set it to too fast with no voice prompts as I needed to enable A2DP profile for navigation only so it just quietly gets on with it.

title: Does not work at all on my Note 3
comment: The app appears to be very buggy.  While setting it up Amazon MP3 player did not appear in the list of apps to offer.  I would up going through the setup 10 or more times while trying to get it to work.  Amazon MP3 appeared once out of all the times I was setting it up.  That was the 5th or 6th attempt.  It disappeared from the list after that never to return.  More importantly the app does nothing when I connect to bluetooth in my car.  Prior to install the app I would get a seemingly random music app starting when I entered my car.  I got this app to try to work around this Android bug so I could choose which app, if any to launch.  But the behavior has not changed.  I still get a random music app starting up when I enter the car.  I do not know what, if anything, the app is doing.

title: Great app, needs some help on Kit Kat
comment: My original comments below are still true, but since Kit Kat hit my phone, I can no longer pause audio using headset controls and this app.  Not sure if it's KK or the LG G2, but when I saw another user posting about it here, I figured I'd chime in.    There's only one media app I use headset buttons with. This app makes it possible to direct all input to the media app without worrying about what app has focus, etc

title: Great App
comment: This app is a fantastic contribution to the open source community.   However would it be possible to allow user selected apps to be opened? I want to use a pressy/mi key dongle to open apps on my phone. I would love to be able to use an app I can trust.

title: Finally! My Casio watch works
comment: Thanks to this app I can now  control Spotify with my Casio watch via Bluetooth to my Nexus 4.  This app plugs an obvious hole in the OS

title: Great!
comment: Fix g-shock+ issue!

title: Fixed my problem
comment: With my gear fit watch it always played my podcasts by default. This gives me the option to play Spotify from my watch unless I specify otherwise. Perfect solution.

title: Sort of works
comment: Voice control is hit or miss.  Doesn't always play the app you tell it to.

title: Prefect!
comment: It worked after rebooting my phone. It does exactly what I needed. This app is highly recommended for anyone who is annoyed when a certain audio app automatically starts playing when connect to Bluetooth. I don't know why there isn't already a way to choose which app you want to start. Thankfully we have this app. I couldn't even get tasker to get it to work the way I wanted.

title: Fantastic
comment: Did exactly what I needed and now makes my car stereo much more useful in the way it interacts with the phone

title: Having trouble with Rhapsody
comment: Hi y'all.  This app is just what I need, except that it doesn't work for me.  I use Rhapsody almost exclusively.  I see it in the list of choices when I configure the app.  However, when the play command comes in from a bluetooth device, Rhapsody is never in the list of choices.  When I go back to the app, Rhapsody is then un-selected.  I am running this on a rooted HTC One.  I'll happily give the app 5 stars when/if it works.

title: Good
comment: I use it to control soundcloud using the app 'media buttons'  But when i press 'pause' the song doesn't pause. Please fix dev :D thankyou

title: Love this app
comment: Now that the bug has been fixed which keeps re -enabling apps after an update, I think this app fills a need and works perfectly with my headset buttons.
This should be fixed in the latest version (1.5.0).

title: Great, but...
comment: Every time an app updates, even if I removed it from the list of apps to launch, it gets re-enabled.  It would be nice to have an option for this.

Hi, after this release this problem should be fixed. Unfortunately, to this I had to change how I stored the ids of hidden apps from the previous release, so that means all your apps that were previously hidden will be visible again when you installed version 1.5.0 of this app. After this though, I think other apps updating will not get re-enabled.

title: Sorry about your car dude
comment: This is a really handy little app, it makes my bluetooth headset way more useful.
Man you're a genius!

title: Awesome!
comment: This fixes the missing PLAY_PAUSE thing on my LG G2! Love it!!

title: simple, effective
comment: thanks.

title: Helpful but sometimes annoying
comment: This is a good app but unfortunately anytime one of your other media apps updates, this will once again selected as an option to play music. Which can be very annoying when you only want your music player to work.
This should be fixed in 1.5.0. Please let me know if you're still seeing it, and the app that it's happening with.

title: Perfect
comment: This app solved my issue of Poweramp automatically playing when the car audio bluetooth connected.

title: Finally
comment: Thanks

title: Almost perfect
comment: Wish it didn't keep adding every updated app to its list.

title: Just doesn't work
comment: If apps are running in background Media Button adds them to your list and automatically checks them when connecting to Bluetooth. Also, it starts all the apps that are checked in the list before it gives a chance to choose one. Removing app.   Galaxy S4

title: Works
comment: Thanks! Was getting annoyed by my ROM selecting Apollo by default and playing ringtones off of my phone.

title: really needed this app
comment: I sync my RAZR to a Jeep UConnect stereo, and I frequently use a TTS app to read emails or web articles aloud. When the jeep sent a command to the phone to allow bluetooth media I would end up with music and TTS playing simultaneously. This app fixed that problem and I can now listen to TTS in peace. THANK YOU

title: Works decently, some apps behave slightly inconsistently
comment: Works pretty well, though I wish it would not re-add apps to the list when they get updated.   I have to regularly remove a bunch of Samsung bloatware from the list, I'd prefer to be able to opt - in new apps to the list.

title: Works as advertised
comment: Using to control my favorite media player and works perfectly. Settings seemed a bit confusing however. Highly recommended. One request: Apps are automatically added to the selection list when updated. Disable that please. Thanks.

title: Beautiful!
comment: Just beautiful the app help solve the hectic behavior of bluetooth headset connected and started the player!  It's a life saver. Hope you can make it launch any installed app, so we can use it to launch utter! the voice commander app.  Thanks

title: Thanks
comment: Simple and effective fix to an incredibly infuriating problem.  No charge.  No adverts.  Just works.

title: Good idea, bad execution
comment: You have to select which app to use every time you press pause/play, and doesn't always respond.

title: Er
comment: Downloaded, with Amazon music playing on headset, got my first call,  program now stuttering music for a bit after the car. If this is a fix for auto play in car, then solution is just as irritating.  Uninstalled

title: Needs new UI
comment: I have had this installed on all my devices, there is nothing like it in the Play Store. My only suggestions are that you update the UI to the latest android guidelines, holo interface, roboto font and scale down the icons and text to fit into the popup and it'll be the part of Android that should have been there from the rip Thanks

title: Just what I needed!
comment: This app was a recommendation on a forum somewhere. I needed to prevent my music apps from auto playing, so I could listen to pocket cast. Google music or Rocket player would start automatically when connected to Bluetooth, even if pocket cast was already playing. This app is the best solution I've found so far to prevent this. It appears to work with pocketcast, Rocket Player, and Google music. I also have iSense installed, but haven tried it since the install.

title: Just what I needed.
comment: This app is just what I needed. I've been switching between two different media player apps, and this just makes the transition so seamless. The description of this app sounds like a cheesy sales pitch for the swiffer lol, but it really does what the advertising suggests and alleviates the pain caused by being picky about your mp3 app. I use it for my bluetooth headphones, and it's just phenomenal.

title: Gray app but a little glitchy on 4.1.2
comment: Please continue support of this app. I would pay for it.

title: Auto adding
comment: I life this a lot, but one little feature would make it perfect. A switch to switch auto adding of updates apps of. What I mean is that every time a app is updated «Media button» automatically recheck the box for that app. I don't want that because then the newly updated app messes with which app is supposed to get the input.

title: BRILLIANT!
comment: This application provides integrated functionality which I wish was stock with Android and my Bluetooth-enabled deck. Love it!

title: Not functional on droid 2 global
comment: It prompts when you press a media button, but does not properly launch any selected ap on my phone.

title: A
comment: Keeps on checking players that I've earlier unchecked,  usually after update on a player app.

title: Love this
comment: Well made. Works great. One suggestion. Have an option to disable visual list. When using headest using the program causes the display to turn on. This is causing battery drain because on the lock screen the program freezes the screen to the on position for some reason. Regardless I love this program so it gets 5 stars. But please try and fix this one thing. Small little option would fix it perfect.

title: Awesome.....!!
comment: Since getting my Sony MDR-1RBT headset this app has sorted a problem I had where I experienced pressing play on my headset would start a mediaplayer that I wasn't remotely interesting listening to... This app solved an irritating problem! Very much appreciated :)
Excellence

title: Gs4 stock
comment: Would it be possible for the program recognize the Sirius Internet mobile app?

title: Stops auto play with car bluetooth!
comment: I am not sure what other utility it may have,  but it does this perfectly.

title: Great!
comment: This app allowed my SmartWatch to work with Google Music. Thanks!

title: Awesome! No more bt autoplay!!
comment: Yes! This great app has fixed the dreaded Google music autoplay bug with my car's bluetooth audio.

title: Works but
comment: Every time an app is installed or updated its added to the active media devices list

title: No Sirius XM?
comment: I usually play Sirius XM in my car but when I connect with my bluetooth in the car, the stupid Google Music app would start playing.  So I downloaded this app, which supports apps that have no music such as flipboard, yet doesn't support Sirius XM.  This doesn't make sense to me and I will try another app until this gets fixed.
Hi, you shouldn't have purchased this app.  It's free. If you got charged money by somebody, you should get your money back.

title: Good but...
comment: Works as expected BUT I've found that when it's enabled my word headset controls no longer work. Can this be fixed?

title: Perfect solution for the car. Not for workout cont
comment: This is exactly what I needed for my car bluetooth interface. The built in stereo unit on my M37 would always play a podcast or music randomly when it finished automatically connecting via bluetooth. Very annoying when you have passengers or simply didn't want to resume a podcast while backing out of a parking space.  The only downside to this is now Google Play Music and my podcast app no longer respond to the wired remote from my headphones. I use my galaxy s3 in the car with bluetooth and wired when I'm cycling. I can no longer hit the button on the wired headset to pause/play music. For those interested, of course, the volume and forward/back/skip functionality still works fine. This app needs an option to only insert itself between the play/pause command after a bluetooth connect/disconnect status change. Then it'd be perfect!

title: Truly awesome app
comment: This app is great if you listen to multiple audio-playing apps - like say podcasts and music.  I have wanted something like this for ages!  I'd give it more than 5 stars if I could :)  STOP PRESS: After using it for a while I have realized that it has broken Voice Dialer.  Voice dialing wont work unless you force stop this app :(

title: Widget Control
comment: When I switched to Google Play Music I lost control of media play/pause with my third part widget.  Using this app restored that by allowing be to really assign Google's Play Music as my default media player.

title: Great idea, doesn't work with Spotify though
comment: I select Spotify as the app I want to start, and then nothing happens. This app does not seem to be able to start Spotify.

title: Superb works perfectly
comment: My S3 after installing UK official Rom started having issues with my Car stereo over blue tooth. Issues like non working play pause controls and frequent audio disconnections. But this app magically fixed the issues. Thanks for the useful app.

title: Disables wired headset buttons
comment: Works great with Bluetooth headphones. However, after upgrading to Jelly Bean I have noticed that I cannot use play/skip buttons on a wired headset if I have this enabled.

title: Simple
comment: Simple, elegant and refined. Well done. Does exactly what I needed and puts the icing on the cake too. Thanks!

title: Fixes the bluetooth autoplay bug!
comment: Excellent app. It stops my car from autoplaying music whenever I connect with bluetooth. I only wish it had an option to not play a sound when the app selection dialog disappears

title: Simple and elegant solution.
comment: This application should be a default part of Android. I cannot understand why Android does not have a feature like this. Gone are the days when application responding to my media controls in an arbitrary order. However, one feature I'd like to see in future versions: Do NOT wake the screen up if the proximitry sensor is covered (i.e. device is in the pocket.). As it is now, the device unlocks and start living it's on life because of the screen being constantly touched while it's in my pocket.

title: Great app
comment: ...however, having compatibility issues with my new HTC One.

title: Thanks!
comment: Just what I was looking for, I was able to program it to use Rdio by default!

title: Average
comment: Keeps turning off and have to always turn back on

title: Just the thing for a car-bonded phone.
comment: Makes it easy to choose what to listen to in the car, helps make sure the buttons get routed consistently. It's a must have if you have more than one music/radio app.

title: Perfect solution for me.
comment: On my old Galaxy S with Gingerbread Rhapsody would autolaunch when I pressed play on the bluetooth unit in my car (Aftermarket Sony).  When I went to the S3 and ICS/Jelly Bean - no more.  This app fixed that and has been absolutely flawless for me.  I can launch rhapsody, or if I'm using Pandora more instead it'll launch that (whatever was your last used).  Works seamlessly even with a pin-locked screen. Never have to take the phone out of my pocket. Very happy with this app!

title: Perfect! Made my car stereo control my music again
comment: On older android versions, I could control the music, but ever since Android 4.2, this functionality was broken. Your app fixed this and I can now control my music again from my car stereo HW buttons!  LOVE the app !!! <3

title: Uninstalled
comment: No matter what settings I used, the app always launched Amazon mp3 instead of the selected app. Too bad, it's a great idea.

title: Fixes a problem that shouldnt exist
comment: I can now use my pebble to control apps other than the default play music app. Song details dont update but controls work. Love the text to speech feature.

title: Sony Xperia s
comment: It's very useful...

title: Great for Pebble users!
comment: Now able to control Spotify from my Pebble watch, it's a bit of a hacky feel, but it's a great workaround for now. Thanks guys.

title: Awesome!
comment: I use Poweramp and never the built-in music player. My car Bluetooth audio was always starting this music player instead Poweramp. I tried to solve this problem by adding a .nomedia file to my music folder, but then the music player started playing my custom ringtones! Solved with this app, excellent, thanks!

title: Works with My Ford Touch
comment: I had been trying to figure out how to get my Droid RAZR HD to work with My Ford Touch in my new Escape. This made it super simple.

title: Works great
comment: I got my new Pebble Watch and could not control music in Google Play.  It worked perfectly after installing this app!

title: Only one problem...
comment: Works perfectly as claimed on my gs3, but the phone unlocks in my pocket every time I start playing something with my headphones. Needs at least an option for the screen interface to be deactivated; or to only activate when the screen is already on.   I'll just leave it disabled for now; but I won't uninstall it, in hope of being alerted of an update with this feature. Then I can use it again and will gladly give the full 5 stars it deserves.

title: No good for me.
comment: Did not work well with my HTC One X and a 2012 Ford Mondeo in car BT system. When paused from the phone, the app just kept saying "Play with..." whatever audio app was in use, then and kept going on and on so it was pointless pausing the music as I got speech instead!

title: Thanks
comment: No ads, and it's free. I been looking for this for so long.

title: Can't use my car stereo without it!
comment: This app makes it easy to choose the app I want to use to play music or podcasts.

title: Works great
comment: Better than other apps I paid for. It stops my default player always opening when blue tooth in the car connects.

title: Great app
comment: Works great with my bluetooth radio adapter in my car. The only thing thats annoying is every time a music app that it recognizes updates it gets selected even if its already unselected

title: Great!
comment: Works as advertised!  Saved me a lot of unnecessary movements and made my life better!

title: *Almost*
comment: I really like this app, except I only want it to pair with one application. So I configured it as such. But then other apps keep getting added back and I find myself constantly fixing the configuration again. That's annoying. If it remembered what I configured it to do, I'd give it a 5.

title: Better, not perfect
comment: Tried on 3 different custom roms. Works well on some, less on others. Always better than without the app though. Biggest fixable issue is there's no option to disable opening the app selected to play. (ie when you click play on a widget, the app doesn't open)

title: Where have you been all my life?
comment: Love this app. Works prefectly so far. Next: make a list app that can be re-organized by any field. Thanks much!

title: Good but
comment: You have to know how to use it.

title: Amazing!
comment: Finally something that lets both my wireless speaker and car stereo control Subsonic, Deadbeef and Pandora in a sane way.  Thank you!

title: works well with some apps
comment: Works well with TuneIn Radio, but not with SiriusXM Internet Radio.

title: Stops annoying auto playback
comment: Thanks! My XPRT was automatically playing music when connected to bluetooth. Was really annoying when I didn't want to b distracted wit music. This app helps. Just ignore the request. Problem solved. Thanks for the info previous poster :)

title: Does not work on Droid Bionic
comment: Installed and it disabled all Bluetooth button input unless I toggled it off, and then I was back to square one.

title: Wow
comment: Excellent. just the solution for my blue tooth connection problems on galaxy s3 with mort player

title: Excellent app - thanks
comment: I couldn't get my new LG HBS 700 Bluetooth headset to control media on my Nexus One (CM7) - this app has fixed that and allows me to choose between Tunein Radio, Player Pro, etc.  Thanks very much to the developer for an excellent app.

title: Fantastic!!
comment: Stopped my music from playing automatically every time I turned the car on. Plus it made listening to music even easier in my car.

title: Fixed audio issues
comment: I've had audio skipping problems with my galaxy nexus on Bluetooth, and at this point I think its safe to say this app has resolved that problem. It has frustrated me to no end, and this app has made my life much better.

title: Cheap car repair
comment: Our new car has one defect: every time I get in the car, by phone starts sending Iron Maiden through the stereo, which really annoys my wife. This app works perfectly in intercepting the activation from the Bluetooth stereo.  In fact, it's better than a fix to the stupid BT programming in the stereo. It even helps me by offering a customized menu of the apps I'm likely to want to listen to in the car.

title: Great when it works
comment: Currently not functional on Android 4.1, force closes on opening.

title: Just what the doctor ordered
comment: I have been searching for something like this for months.   Tried Tasker but could never get right.  This comes pretty close! Thanks!

title: Pandora pause works
comment: Since upgrading my Verizon Motorola DROID RAZR from Gingerbread to Ice Cream Sandwich Pandora lost the ability to pause using my Bluetooth headset.  Pandora tech support was no help until I found this application and fixed it.  Thank you!

title: Tried in ford falcon bf 2009 model
comment: Fail to stream through in car Bluetooth....

title: Audible
comment: Please add audible as a selectable media source.

title: Doesn't do anything
comment: This app has no noticeable affect on my phone at all.

title: Thanks
comment: I really need this for my bluetooth car stereo, and it works perfect. Sometimes if a phonecall comes through, it loses track of the last used device for music. Wishlist: ability to send song info to bluetooth device, which doesn't work for most of my apps except the default music player. Droid 3 and Sony stereo.

title: Awesome
comment: I'd give this 5 stars if it didn't block the earphone headset button from working. An option to make it only work when a connected to a blue tooth device would be great.

title: Solved my problem
comment: Media Button Router to the rescue!  The out of the box function for my Samsung Droid Charge was unpredictable at best and completely infuriating at worst.  When a bluetooth phone call would end, you had a 33% chance any of the following would happen:  a) whatever music/player app you were listening to before the call would resume (ok), b) the default music player would start playing (worse), c) both the previous player app and music player would would resume playing (mind boggling).  Now, I can simply rely on the fact that Media Button Router will route the bluetooth event back the previous app or let me choose.  Exactly how I like it.

title: thank you!!!! makes bluetooth work with winamp
comment: stupid winamp wouldn't detect anything whereas other music apps worked fine.  this app made winamp finally detect my bluetooth headset.

title: Mostly works
comment: I installed a new aftermarket stereo in my car and found that the Bluetooth feature worked randomly with my HTC incredible 2 phone. When you pressed the play/pause button you could never be sure which app would start playing. With this app the situation is much improved but not perfect. Sometimes the announcement of the app that is selected gets truncated. Sometimes the pause button says it is going to pause, but as soon as the announcement ends the app resumes playing. But most of the time it works.

title: Why...
comment: hasn't Google bought this app from the developer yet?

title: Works but...
comment: Breaks the ICS Lock screen music controls.

title: Doesn't Work with CarTunes.
comment: Since that's the player I use, this app can't help me.  It works just fine otherwise.  4 stars for the effort.

title: Solves One Problem, Creates Another
comment: This program made it so that I could use the play/pause button on my car's bluetooth system again.  However, it seems to blocks the signal from my wired headset so that I can't use the play/pause button my wired headset.
I don't understand this application

title: It worked for me
comment: Solved the problem of auto play of music after pairing with Bluetooth car radio and HTC Incredible 2.

title: A+++
comment: Very nice. Now I don't miss CM7 so much anymore. This, coupled with Widgetsoid, allows you to control your current media player through your drop-down notifications panel. It also defaults to the last media player used in my car dock instead of a specific one all the time. Very tiny annoyance but this took care of it nonetheless.

title: Fills a hole in ICS, otherwise not worth it
comment: Google changed a setting in the way Android handles bluetooth remote inputs, which made lots of apps no longer respond correctly. This solves that problem, though it does it in a clunky way. The minute all my audio apps update, I'll no longer use this and won't miss it.
Thank so much for making this app. Shame on Google for making it necessary.

title: Perfect in my car
comment: Makes Pandora useable in my car over Bluetooth. Also love the simple confirmation dialog.
READ MY MIND

title: Thank you!
comment: Google music oppressiveness thwarted! (Gnex)

title: AWESOME!!!!
comment: This app restored my faith in Android (as an Apple convert).  It put the track and play/pause control back on my Motorola S10-HD headphones when used with Powrramp, and I'm psyched!  Thanks, man!

title: Missing Audible Support
comment: Seems to work with Music and Pandora on my ICS GNex, but it doesn't seem to recognize Audible as a media app.

title: No Longer Works
comment: Back in the days when this worked on the N1, it was an awkward but functional app.  All these updates broke it.  Now I feel beaten down into submission by Google.

title: the most important application for Bluetooth handset owners
comment: It fixed the most annoying Android "feature" I know. Thanks a lot to the author!

title: Perfect

title: Highly Recommended
comment: I was seriously considering going back to iOS for portable music because of the very annoying unpredictability of the play/pause button due to apps competing for audio. This app fixes it perfectly.

comment: solved spotify + beats wireless (play/pause) problem.  thanks so much harleen sahni

title: Great ideea, great app
comment: With Gingerbread I had a 50/50 chance to start Grooveshark or Google Music. The upgrade to ICS came with bluetooth issues and so I found this great app that fixed both my problems! Thank you!

title: AWESOME!
comment: This really fixes the issue in ICS on my Nexus S (4.0.3)! Thanks dev! :-)

title: Thankyou!
comment: You've fixed the problem I've had with Spotify not handling BT play/pause commands after ICS update! Thanks!

title: Phenomenal app!!!
comment: thank you sooo much for this app fixes avrcp issues with galaxy nexus! Thanks again can't say enough!!

title: Updates have fixed ICS compatibility.
comment: The best media app I have, makes driving and using my phone much safer and easier.

title: Save it
comment: Please do not end of life this app with ics!!  Will donate to the cause.  Just say you will please save it.   ICS will suck without MBR.
Works great could use some dev but no complaint thank you thank you!

title: Great app!
comment: Great app! Thanks for the ability to edit which app options are listed.

title: Vn
comment: Loving it

title: Works first but now switch menu doesn't appear
comment: It works but how can you force the switch menu to come up? It came up a couple of times seemingly randomly, but now doesn't appear anymore at all!

title: Works like magic!
comment: Before finding this app, had huge problems controlling podcast/music apps with Bluetooth AVRCP controls. Media Button Router has helped me choose audio apps that respond to Bluetooth properly. Now I can take My Samsung Galaxy S on walks knowing I can pause/play my music/podcasts and switch from music to podcasts and back with 100% reliability!

title: Been looking for this a long time
comment: Android never handled AVCRP correctly. This app actually uses Text-to-Speech to announce what you're controlling and let's you switch to other apps by using the FF/RW button. Very handy!

title: Great app!
comment: Great app!

title: Fantastic
comment: Does exactly what I wanted it to do, and what it says it does. No more apps hijacking the bluetooth audio in my car.

title: Perfect
comment: Exactly what I was looking for. It senses what app to use and does it. Great!
Perfect! Makes the headphones usable! Should be built in - hope Google or HTC consider it.
Very nice app.. very easy to us when you have one player each for books, podcast, and pandora. Plz add donate
Simple, basic utility app that does exactly what it says. If you need this, you know it, and it's a lifesaver.
Does exactly what it says. Fantastic app

title: Awsome, would not use BT with out it.
comment: I don't understand why this functionality is not built into android. Apparently none of them own a vehicle that is capable of Bluetooth streaming! WITHOUT THIS APP, I would hit next track on my Ford SYNC system and all my players started playing at the same time! Rhapsody, Slacker and PlayerPro, Argh!!! Thanks so much for this app, its worth $$ to me. Keep up the good work. (HTC Thunderbolt)

title: He did what Google could not
comment: Music no longer automatically blasts whenever I get in the car. Harleen should be hailed as an Android hero.
It would be so great if there was an option to do nothing when media buttons are pressed.
Works great, but make sure on Bluetooth headphone that supports phone audio to disable this.

title: Ford Sync works again!
comment: Thanks! Now the Ford Sync system works with my phone and I didn't need to root it!
Works perfectly. Just what I was looking for!
Been searching for this!
Just the app I was hoping for.
Been waiting for this app! So far really good. I wish there was a way to choose a default music app. Winamp. Droid x.
Probably works, but not in Droid X 4.5.588 gingerbread update.

title: It Works!
comment: I started using this yesterday and so far this has been working really well. I use Grooveshark and Google Listen a lot, and this has been working fine between them.
Working well so far. Only issue is it doesnt recognize Amazon MP3 player.
